website_summaries.verdict: Number one best seller on Amazon is also an affordable option that doesn't sacrifice quality.
pros: Extra large angles of the mirror are wide enough that you can see your entire infant
Made from a shatter proof acrylic glass that will withstand any type of impact
Mirror comes attached to a pivoting handle that allows for full mobility
cons: Some customers found it difficult to attach the mirror to the car seat

website_summaries.verdict: A wide, pivoting mirror for a rear-facing car seat passenger.
pros: Mirror glass is shatterproof and highly maneuverable
Some parents say they can see both a middle-seat passenger and a side passenger
cons: Some parents say the convex nature of the mirror distorts the image of the child too much

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this item since it allowed me to keep an eye on my newborn baby girl. But after only 6 weeks of use, the strap broke. It has a black dusty residue there it broke, too. Thankfully it didn't break and fall on my baby while driving. Several other reviewers said this same thing happened to them, so it's definitely a low quality product. Please do yourself a favor and go with a different mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this mirror! We actually just bought a second one! It’s large enough that we can both see baby from our seats and baby can easily see us! It doesn’t seem to ever fog and doesn’t really get dirty either. There’s also next to no warping even bear the edges. They’re easy to attach and a state trooper even commented once how impressed he was with how secure they were at a car seat inspection station!
customer_reviews.author: dawnariana

customer_reviews.title: Great size, clarity and holds steady
customer_reviews.text: I went through a few rear view mirrors before finally getting this one. Very happy with it. It's easy to attach. Although...it buckles onto the back of seats so it can be a little challenging to attach to seats that do NOT have a space between the headrest and the actual seat if that makes sense. The seats in our car do not have a gap and we did have to adjust the straps a bit to make it secure. However, it's worth the effort. The size and clarity of the mirror are great and unlike the ones we tried before, we don't have any issue with the mirror falling because the ball joint is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS and DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product until yesterday. In just a few months the straps holding the mirror onto the head rest completely disintegrated. The mirror ended up falling into the car seat with my baby. Fortunately, she wasn’t hurt or startled by it but this is a huge safety concern. I contacted amazon and demanded a refund and formally complained about this product, asking them to remove it from their website. If this has also happened to you, I suggest you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke and could have fell right on baby!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this barely over a month and the straps just broke. Luckily my 4 month old was not in the car when they broke or this giant mirror would have fell right on her! Not to mention we live in Arizona, where it's 100+ degrees - things get HOT in the car, so this could have been very dangerous! Edit: just looked at other reviews, and it looks like this is an ongoing problem. Not sure how it has such a high rating
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: WorkED perfectly, until...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: after ten months of use (through Fall, Winter, and Spring. Not in extremely hot weather), the straps that hold the mirror onto the headrest have begun to completely dissolve away. It’s leaving black particles everywhere and the straps are fraying completely. Cannot use anymore for risk of the straps breaking. Very disappointed :( Love my mirror! It is super strong and secure, so I’m never worried about it breaking or hitting my baby. I love how wide it is. It is super easy to see my baby in the rear view mirror. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AAM

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, assumes you already know how to install it.
customer_reviews.text: The mirror is okay so far, we did just put them in over the weekend. As parents who have never installed one of these in their car before it was a pain to figure out how it was supposed to attach. There were no instructions in the package, but there was a nice laminated piece of paper telling you what to do if you were happy/unhappy with the product. I would have preferred it come with instructions even if they were just printed on the box.
customer_reviews.author: icanseecanada

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Just OK. Nothing like the marketing pictures (notice the baby in the mirror is not the same pose as baby looking at the mirror). The marketing leads you to believe that you get wonderful visibility but that is not true - first the mirror distorts the image but also there is no way to get a good view. The best I can do is have the mirror look all funky bent and see the top of my infants head.
customer_reviews.author: sendittokeith

customer_reviews.title: Ideal mirror for rear facing carseats
customer_reviews.text: When my kiddos were rear-facing the first two years and I stopped sitting between them, this was the next option. We purchased these mirrors since they were shatterproof. The frame is made of plastic and the mirror is not a real glass piece. It's a reflective mirror that's clear enough for you to see your babies when you need a quick check. A downside to the mirror is the strap. There are two straps that buckle in on the head rest. They move around easily at the slightest touch and would eventually slide down. We had to adjust it constantly. This item could easily be a 5 star if they made slide proof straps.
customer_reviews.author: HDN

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is a little disappointing. It would seem so easy to install because it's just two buckle clips, but in order to get it to stay it has to be very snug, but once you've gotten it to the fitted length, it is difficult to clip. Also, it so easily moves, that if you bump it while buckling in your child, you can not see them at all once you sit in your own seat... then you have to get back out and adjust it. Lastly, the image /reflection in the mirror is severely distorted at a certain angle! (I bought two of these, and it only seems to happen with one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Like many other buyers, which I discovered after this happened to me, the straps on our mirror tore apart after a few months of use. Not reliable, not a good product. I am very disappointed. Thankfully, it didn't fall on my toddler as it was positioned right above her carseat! I was moving the mirror a little and the whole thing literally tore off the headrest into my hands. The straps left a horrible black dust residue all over my hands and headrest. Up until this happened, I liked this mirror. It doesn't shake and works well. Until it doesn't work at all because I can't attach it now. Would not recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Got one for my wifes cars and we like it so much we got a second for mine
customer_reviews.text: Got one for my wifes cars and we like it so much we got a second for mine. It works awesome. Wish we had bought these from the beginning. Kid loves to be able to see us when we look back at him and it also makes it so we can see what he's doing. Its nice and big, reflection is clear, doesn't rattle at all like I read about some other versions of these things, seems like it is a quality product, works great, and was a great price. When shopping for these I saw others that we twice+ the price for the same thing. This thing is great and is quality. Huge fan
customer_reviews.author: N. True

customer_reviews.title: 3-star Baby Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I was in between this baby mirror and another Go brand from Targét. I purchased this one, but it isn’t as sturdy as you’d think, it’s wiggles around too much, going over speed bumps, potholes, etc. and I tied it as tight as possible. I wasn’t left too impressed. I purchased the one I was in between at Targét and it worked great and I didn’t run into any issues with it being loose at all. I would’ve returned this one, but it’s passed the return date so it’s just in a closet collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Put Your Mind at Ease
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product that allows you to see what's going on with you baby in the backseat. Nice large mirror size. Have noticed that after transitioning from infant carseat to Extend-2-fit, it's a lot more difficult to see because of how much higher up the newer carseat sits. My baby is now 2yo, and with her sister on the way at the end of the summer, we'll probably have to get another one of these mirrors so I can see them both.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E. Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Big, but great
customer_reviews.text: I insisted I didn't want a mirror because I thought it would be too distracting, so I didn't register for one. Sure enough once baby came I ended up coming on here and ordering what turned out to be a rather ginormous mirror. I love having it though. I think baby has figured out he can see me a bit and when he starts to cough it's reassuring to look back and see if he's okay. Despite it's size it doesn't distract me from driving as much as I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes driving with Baby much more comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Very very happy with this purchase! Before buying it, I drove a few times with Baby in the back and I had to make a few stops to check that everything was fine. Now I have this mirror which offers a big view of the car seat and I feel much more comfortable driving with it. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sebnem Cecile

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It was easy to install and provides a great view of the child in the rear facing car seat. It took me about two minutes to install in and the only strange thing is that when I look in the car's rear view mirror, I keep seeing what is going on in front of the car, which was a bit unusual. It has nothing to do with the product, but if you install it, make sure it is aligned properly for best viewing.
customer_reviews.author: John F. FisherTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts. Mirror works as intended otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Product was missing some of the parts needed to properly clip it to the back of the headrest. Manufacturer emailed me, asking if everything went well with my purchase. I was excited, thinking they had proactive customer service. I emailed them back about the missing pieces... aaaaand have never heard back from them. Otherwise, I forced it to work this far and the mirror itself works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Brady & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror for our 18 month-old!
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this mirror. It was a little larger than I expected, but it fits perfectly on the seat! Our little one (18 months) really got a kick out of it and having the mirror in place allows him to see more from his back-facing car seat. It's a sanity saver for sure! From the parent's perspective, it's nice to be able to glance up at the rearview mirror and catch baby's reflection. Perfect for seeing if baby is sleeping or otherwise doing okay when things get a little quiet.
customer_reviews.author: RB Frost

customer_reviews.title: I hate this mirror so much
customer_reviews.text: I've been meaning to write this review for a while now, but I've been trying to give the product multiple chances. I hate this mirror so much. It does not stay up no matter what my husband or I do. I bought two and I'm really glad I didn't open the second box (although I just learned my return window has closed 🙄) hopefully I can sell it because I don't plan on using either one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for older kids
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you don't have older kids who bump into it!! It can easily be moved by their wandering heads. Other than that it stays where it's supposed to. Installation was easy, but took my S.O. a while (he's not always the brightest). It stays tight on the headrest. And speaking of headrest, it works only for a car that has one in the backseat. Other than all that, I like it and it works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Straps deteriorate in the sun.
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year after purchase, the straps deteriorated to the point they tear like paper. I am sure this is because of sun damage, my mirror was installed in a sedan. The mirror and adjustment are great, that’s the only reason it still gets 4 stars. Worked so well I think I will get some hook & loop strapping to reattach it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Mirror I’ve Tried
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best mirror I’ve tried, and I’ve tried a lot. It is very clear and slightly convex for a wider view. I was having trouble seeing over the handle of my car seat so I turned it long ways and now I can see my baby perfectly. The straps are a bit difficult to tighten and it took a bit longer than I expected to buckle on, but it doesn’t move when I drive unlike many other mirrors I’ve tried. We will be buying a second for hubby’s car.
customer_reviews.author: Angela RothTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - Not safe!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this mirror at first and love being able to see my baby in the back seat while I'm driving, but the straps that hold it onto the headrest broke within a month or two of use. They basically disintegrated and black dust comes of when I touch the straps. This is not safe for a baby! It could have fallen on and hurt my baby while i was driving! I tried contacting the seller but they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: A Pain to Install
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is a major pain to install. Once installed it still moves easily (kid kicks it, you bump into it putting the kid into the car seat, etc). Also, the quality of the image you see is not the clearest. We went with the Diono Easy View Baby Mirror for our other car and have loved that one.
customer_reviews.author: apet25

customer_reviews.title: Great Help!
customer_reviews.text: This mirror works great in my SUV! i had another mirror that was smaller that i could only see the babies face. my SUV has dark tint and dark seats, add a dark carseat and its hard to see my little guy. This mirror helped with that! not only can i see him more clearly in lower lights, but i can see most of his body which is helpful. the mirror was easy to install and is easily adjusted. only complaint is that it is easy to bump the mirror and move it sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: MissMega

customer_reviews.title: It works.  I mean, what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product. Put it in my ‘14 forester. If everything right, you’re good. I didn’t have any problems. It has a big viewing surface. I was able to see the little one very well. Definitely adds peace of mind. The mirrored surface is some sort of plastic. The unit is fairly light weight. Still feels sturdy though.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this mirror in a Prius on the rear headrest, driver's side, and it works great. The mirror is bright and large and does not interfere with the vision from the driver's rear view mirror. I mounted it on a removed headrest reinstalled the headrest and lastly made the minor adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: ellen f

customer_reviews.title: Distorts image
customer_reviews.text: The mirror casing is sturdy. The mirror/ casing connection is not as sturdy. The actual mirror itself, though durable, gives a terribly distorted image... the first time I turned to look at my baby grandson, I literally jumped in fear because it didn't look like him. In that split second, I was so startled, it gave me chills.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Pivot mount causes movement in a minivan. Might be better in a smooth car, but did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: The mounting style for this mirror uses a base-plate and pivot ball. What this caused in my minivan was the mirror to vibrate and wobble a lot. Over every single bump, the mirror was vibrating all over the place. Was not able to see baby clearly due to vibration. I also worried baby would get car sick if she stared at the wobbling image too long. I returned it for a mirror that straps directly to the headrest without a pivot mount.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Mathot

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to install on my own
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before purchasing a mirror. This mirror is large and the view is clear. It swivels well to adjust perfectly and doesn't move or fall when driving. It was very easy to install on my own. Two buckles attach it to the headrest. I love that I can see my daughter when it's just us two in the car. It will also serve us well once we have another baby because it looks like it will show two car seats wide. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Mirror clarity is fine but the backing slips down the headrest that it's attached to so I have to readjust frequently. Annoying but tolerable. UPDATED REVIEW 05/14/2020 We've been using this mirror for three years now and it just broke. Clarity has never been great and it's bulky. Next time, I plan on buying the Brica car mirrors that attach to the headrest with fabric so that it can't break off. Seems like a safety hazard if we were ever in an accident. Would not buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hancyclopedia

customer_reviews.title: Cheap mirror, hard to see reflection.
customer_reviews.text: Great in concept but the mirror is very low quality and nearly impossible to see when there's a lot of sunlight. And it the straps to secure it are much harder than necessary to tighten and loosen. Definitely will be looking to replace this with something better.
customer_reviews.author: DLosangeles

customer_reviews.title: Have 3 and love them!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these for our 3 rear facing children in the middle row of our honda odyssey. I can see all 3 kids perfectly in the rear view mirror and they can all happily watch their dvd through their mirrors. We had 1 slip down but that was our fault from the way we installed. I love these mirrors and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: readerlily

customer_reviews.title: WASTED my money
customer_reviews.text: So I have a fusion and my back seats do not have movable head rests. FYI make sure you do otherwise this product is a WASTE! I rigged mine up with double sided tape and a bungee cord thingy. Wish I knew all this before I bought it! I’m a single mom and extra hassle makes my life harder! Ughhhh
customer_reviews.author: bethan ellars

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazzard Straps!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the mirror for about 4 months during the summer. I went to adjust the mirror and the step completely tore apart! I checked the other strap and it too was disintegrating. I'm going to be contacting the company about a refund or replacement. Until the straps became a safety hazard for my infant, the mirror was good. I could see him well, it held in place and it didn't shake. Etid: I bumped up to 2 stars for their customer service. The company responded very promptly and issued a full refund. I was very happy that it wasn't an issue. I won't buy the mirror again, but I would buy other products.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Fritzler

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy, Kiddo enjoys it more than I do
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, it's really helpful to see whether a sneeze is just a sneeze or a snot ejection exercise, and to help calm or cheer up my son when he's cranky in the backseat. I think he likes it more than I do! It was easy to install and I'm thinking about ordering another one for my husband's vehicle or rental cars when we travel. I will probably make this a standard gift to my friends as they start their families.
customer_reviews.author: Phillips T.H.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT STAY IN PLACE AND FALLS ON BABY!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over 6 months and it has never worked. I spend FOREVER lining it up so I can see my baby and then as soon as I turn or go over a speed bump it moves and I cannot see my baby for the rest of the car ride. I have adjusted it so many times, the mirror FALLS OFF ONTO MY BABY. it broke and is a piece of garbage! DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vico and Steph

customer_reviews.title: Not shatterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on December 22nd I believe and installed it the on New Year’s Day. I purchased it because of all the good reviews it had. However, after using for only two weeks, the glass has shattered after my toddler leaned his head on it in the seat. Now, this is advertised as shatterproof. It makes me wonder what would happen if I was actually in an accident and the glass shattered with my infant in the seat? I wish I could be refunded for what I spent on this product or get a better product as a replacement. This was a complete disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mommaof2

customer_reviews.title: Try another mirror
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mirror at first other than it required constant readjustment. I could see him most of the time until it shimmied in a downward position. He rides in the middle and I had it attached to the rear driver's side headrest so it wouldn't fall on him. That's why the swiveling adjustment was convenient. Unfortunately after 7 months of use the plastic holding the swivel part broke so it's now completely useless. You may want to look elsewhere. I still haven't found one that completely fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jay the Mom

customer_reviews.title: Straps are Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: At first, the Mirror was working okay. After some time, I noticed the straps were not working well and the mirror would sag. When I tried to adjust them, they completely broke and disintegrated. Incredibly disappointing. I will have to buy another mirror from a different company now.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Our little one has some gagging/refulx issues so I ride in the back often. However, I needed something for when I have to run around alone and don't have someone to watch her. This works perfect. It was realky easy to install on back headrest, easy to adjust to see in review mirror and is a nice big size. worth it.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmel269Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should. Great size!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this mirror. I can check on my baby easily whether I'm in the passenger seat or the driver's seat looking in the rear view mirror. My baby is also very entertained by the mirror. It's been bonked around a bit and no damage to the mirror itself. I do wish it was easier to set up and more stable. It hasn't fallen or anything but if you bump into it, it's a pain getting it tight on the headrest again.
customer_reviews.author: B. DeKo

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and gets the job done! It was easy to install and adjust the way we need it. Will probably purchase this again for our other vehicle - so that should tell you enough!
customer_reviews.author: Cole Warford

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit a rectangular headrest
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the strapping mechanism just doesn't fit the backseat headrest in my 2017 Silverado. My head rest is relatively long width and shorter height. The straps on this mirror seem to almost exclusively fit a more square shaped headrest.
customer_reviews.author: Batman2190

customer_reviews.title: Very necessary thing to have in your car if you drive with you child.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mirror. Driving without it is super scary. It has sturdy straps in the back which you can make tighter or looser as needed. I kinda wish the mirror had a light but that's not super necessary for me since when I'm driving at night, my son usually falls asleep. I can always turn on the back light in the car to see him if needed. Note to buyers- i think it says to clip the harness parallel to each other. I did a crisscross because it felt more sturdy this was.
customer_reviews.author: Ayna

customer_reviews.title: Must have for paranoid mamas
customer_reviews.text: I'm that paranoid freak mom that needs to see her baby at all times.. . That being said a mirror is a must have. What I dont like is that it moves so much as your driving from bumps and such so I'm constantly having to straighten it out after we reach our destination.
customer_reviews.author: CassieFaith

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust. For very large headrests only.
customer_reviews.text: Mirror is nice and big but the way the straps attached, we couldn’t tighten down enough in our car (Jeep). The straps aren’t as shown in the listing. There are extra unnecessary buckles that get in the way and are difficult to adjust. We have a similar one with different straps that works great.
customer_reviews.author: QualityComfortStyle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Adjust & Install - Great Size & Crystal Clear!
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is great and easily installed & adjusted! I wish they had this type of mirror when my other 3 children were babies! It was always such a pain adjusting the regular mirrors - I love how you can adjust it to any angle! The mirror is also very big & clear! I'm very happy with this purchase! Side note - there is a picture on the box of a cute kid buckled into the strangest car seat. It looks just like a 5-point harness car seat....but without the chest clip...there's no way that's safe!! Anyways, mamas, you will love this mirror!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allows me to drive with out wondering bout baby!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a must for any parent or grandparent who has a child on a rear facing car seat. I no longer have to stop the car to see if hes "really" choking or just making noise, or is he sleeping, or just for peace of mind actually. Price is just right too.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa1106

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not great
customer_reviews.text: This mirror worked okay for a little while, but it was very hard to attach to the head rest and didn't want to stay on tight. I had to readjust it a lot but it would still end up slipping and bouncing around after a while.
customer_reviews.author: lawood

customer_reviews.title: Don't work in cars with small headrests
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in past car, but have 2 of these and they don't work with small headrests. Since they are held in place but straps that clip together, you can only get the loops to a certain size, and unfortunately, that's not nearly small enough for our Volvo or Audi. I've had to get creative and add pieces of foam (like pool noodles) to get them tight enough to the headrest.
customer_reviews.author: dpn108

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who had given birth to her fourth child and couldn't keep herself from looking in the back seat. It does exactly what it says it will do. She can glance back and see the baby clearly, and she can even see the image in her rear view mirror. I wish it had been around when my girls were little!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Summers

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Straps
customer_reviews.text: We've had this mirror for about a year and a half and the straps completely disintegrated and left a black dust all over my hands and my car. Very disappointed with the quality. Other problems (too easy to move, didn't stay put) were annoying, but this is unsafe and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: songofjoy00711

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mirror. I had one with my first child, that one was from well known brand and was worse quality and was not easy to adjust. This one is much better. My husband had some troubles tightening the strap I believe but one installed the mirror is great. Good size! And the color matches our car light interior very good.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna P.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for parents!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for parents with children who are rear facing. Quick and Easy to install and makes car rides so much easier. Not only can you see your child but they can also see you and it helps put them at ease. The product itself is durable and high quality. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Saechao

customer_reviews.title: Cracked mirror
customer_reviews.text: We loved the mirrors, but recently one of them cracked in the middle. It's just been on our seat so not sure what happened to it. I thought maybe some weird contraction from the cold weather caused it. It's not a horrible crack, but not a good review for the mirror itself. Haven't had them for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Large secure mirror
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is quite large (about the size of an iPad) and does minimally obstruct the rear view window of my Honda Civic. It fit securely on the headrest of my cloth seats by creating an "x" with the straps and then tightening as much as possible. The mirror has a mount on the back that sits against your headrest and allows you to swivel up/down/left/right so that you can see the car seat and baby. This mirror was easy to install and I do not have any concerns about it falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Durable and Easy Install!
customer_reviews.text: As a parent that always wants to be aware of what my child is doing in the back seat, I really like this product. the mirror is a great size and it's adjustability allows me to easily and quickly check on my child. The mounting was simple and quick. The mirror is mounted to an adjustable arm and can be articulated to many positions. I have not had any problems with this product and was surprised at the quality and sturdiness of it. The mirror will stay in place even on bumpy roads.
customer_reviews.author: J Polo

customer_reviews.title: Nice mirror. Photos are deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Nice mirror. Photos are deceiving, this has a definite "wide-angle" view. Also very large (size-wise) compared to others. This may not be a problem for some, but can also block the view in some smaller cars.
customer_reviews.author: C. Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Nice and big
customer_reviews.text: This one is big and very easy to adjust. I don't have the same problem as other reviewers that said the mirror would eventually fall and baby would be out of sight. It swivels easy but the ball socket that connects it is tight enough to be stable in a bumpy car. This one is a replacement for another one I had, that broke, and I like this one much better. It was easy to install, adjusts easy, and it's big so you see more than just a beautiful baby face. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Z

customer_reviews.title: Love the orbital ball
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mirror for my husband new vehicle so he could see our baby girl and I ended up taking it because I liked it so much and gave him my old one. It is very large so I can see her and she can see me. I LOVE the orbital ball that gives the ability to turn the mirror down towards her. It fits our jeep grand Cherokee headrest on the tightest setting.
customer_reviews.author: lei

customer_reviews.title: Recommended! Nice and big.
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived almost opened and it was crushed(reason for 4stars) but luckily the mirror was fine. Also it arrived very quickly ! I was so happy. The mirror is big and it's exactly what we needed. The straps are easy to adjust to any head rest. We have a Toyota fun cargo and it works great for our seats. Happy with this product. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for the best, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson so I could see him in my car. My son in law recommended this one to us. He researches everything and only buys the best! We love it! Very sturdy, easily adjustable, and has a clear view. Not only does us allow to see our grandson it allows him to see things! The constant movement keeps his attention so he’s not as fussy in the car! I highly recommend this mirror!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to position
customer_reviews.text: I have the ones that just straps to the head rest but it didn't work that great because it would never face down toward baby all the time. I would have to stick a small item to it would stay facing down and It would shift from time to time. With this adjustable mirror, I can see my baby with no issues. Love this out of all mirrors out there.
customer_reviews.author: LocalBraddah

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product! Straps disintegrated in only 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. It lasted 4 months before the straps disintegrated and the mirror just fell on top of my baby . When I told them about my experience they said they have 30 day return policy, but would offer 25% off. No, thank you! Why would I purchase another poor quality product that will only last another couple of months. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Worth a million dollars and baby happiness
customer_reviews.text: This has probably been the best gift I've given my grandson in his first two years of life. He hated riding in the car and went to Scream the entire time until this was installed. Being able to see mommy or daddy made his car world so much happier!
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Because my backseat headrest isn’t adjustable (Nissan Altima) I cant secure the mirror how I want. Did my best pray it doesn’t fall off and smack my baby. It’s a big mirror. Great price, I’m pleased, would recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift for 1st Time Parents!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good gift especially for first time parents. To avoid turning around while driving a parent can glance and see that an infant who is facing backwards is okay. By the time baby is facing forward parents should be less anxious and not need the mirror😋.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The shift-able mount is firm and wont move after you get the correct angle. Smaller headrests may be unable to get a firm mount with the straps. Straps can be complicated if you need to make quick adjustments or move between vehicles. I ended up buying a second one for this reason. Overall a great product with near perfect clarity with the mirror image.
customer_reviews.author: Trever Logston

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: I like the mirror so far! I've had it for a week and it certainly alleviates my stress of wondering how my newborn is doing while I am driving. It was easy to strap to the head rest. The only thing is that when I look through my rearview mirror, the reflection of my newborn's face appears quite a bit smaller than I had hoped. she looks really tiny! But I am getting used to it. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Mama

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Used it several times since bringing the baby home. It does seem to shift a little every time we get into the car so we have to adjust it but it's large enough to see easily and it's not hard to re-adjust it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This mirror works great. My wife is the primary user and loves this mirror. Allows her to drive and still be able to see our son in the back seat without any issue. The mirror is nice and large so it gives a really nice sized viewing area and covers a broad area. Easy to install, only took at most 5 minutes. Will recommend this to all my friends that are parents.
customer_reviews.author: AMasterofMayheM

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent rearview mirror. It attaches well as long as you have a center headrest above the child to strap it to. Our Expedition did not have one, so we strapped it to a dog barrier we also bought on Amazon and it stays in position well. The image of the child is small and dark but we have very deep tinted windows. It stays steady while driving and stays in position on the friction mount.
customer_reviews.author: HotRods4Ever

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Brought for my daughter/grandson , my daughter was to afraid to drive herself with the baby due to her not being able to see him , so I brought this because it is shatterproof which is awesome cause you never know , she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Gspluvr

customer_reviews.title: These mirrors are amazing! They adhere easily to the back headrests
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are amazing! They adhere easily to the back headrests, hold their adjustment and don't fall during bumpy rides and have a view that would make any kid and parent happy. For the self-aware helicopter parents such as myself, you can see not only your wonderful offspring's face but also their entire body, the car seat, some of the door and parts of the back seat. Quite an impressive span! I would highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Arcanis28

customer_reviews.title: Frayed straps that broke
customer_reviews.text: After having this item for about a year and a half, the straps completely frayed and broke. The item was never removed from its original placement, and never messed with, so i guess the straps are just poor quality. I will purchase a new brand, as I want one that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Superhero Lover

customer_reviews.title: They are some of the best I’ve had.
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes yes. These match my tan leather and it looks like they belong in the car, not like an after market product, which I love. I bought two so I can see both of my babies and I love it. Very clear and easy to position. Not too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: sky padilla

customer_reviews.title: This is good if it's on sale
customer_reviews.text: This is good if it's on sale. The mirror works well and is convex so you don't have to worry about focus points creating a reflective burn. The main reason for 3 stars is that it isn't very durable. It fell while being moved onto the seat and cracked the reflective part with that small distance/force.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Go elsewhere for a product that will last longer than 8 months
customer_reviews.text: In the beginning I liked it, wide angle view and very easy to maneuver the mirror. Like with a lot of the other reviews the strap just disintegrated after about 8 months. I only moved the mirror to another car once! Considering an infant will probably be rear facing until about 1.5 - 2 years old, lasting 8 months doesn't cut it. I would need 3 of these per child! This company's warranty is only 30 days, probably because they know their cheap materials will be able to just last that long! Do yourself a favor and buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig & Veronica Burgess

customer_reviews.title: comforting and simple
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is genius! I had been constantly asking my older child to let me know how the baby is because babies should be rear faced until they're 2 but it is frustrating to not be able to see her, especially on long drives. Well this changes all that! Plus bonus! She loves to look at herself and it distracts her just enough so I can get her buckled up and get going! I feel much better now that I can see my baby! (just make sure to focus on the road of course!) Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Mirror doesn't give a very clear image and is difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Mirror doesn't give a very clear image and is difficult to see our baby even in the daytime on account of how dark it is. Not sure if this has to do with our dark tinted windows, but we have found this mirror to be minimally helpful, as most of the time the passenger has to turn around and check on the baby anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality straps won’t last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this mirror for 2 years now. The mirror itself is fine and functional, and does what it’s supposed to do. The strap, however, is so low quality that I cannot recommend this product. Within a few weeks, the straps loosened so the mirror would fall and I couldn’t see the baby. They had to be tightened repeatedly. Then 6 months in, the straps broke leaving a bunch of black dust everywhere. Terrible, low quality product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zuck

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my car
customer_reviews.text: The product was in great condition and price, but I could not install in my car year 2006. I tried to return but I had to pay shipping which was about 70% of the total price of about $11. Kept it and will sell it at a yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Large, entertains baby, shatterproof
customer_reviews.text: Nice and big. Easy to see your child without having to turn your head. Also very entertaining, he likes seeing himself in it. Sometimes the straps slide off the headrest, that’s the only con I can think of after using it for several months. I like that it’s shatterproof also.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Hong

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second mirror I have bought for my car and I can’t believe it took me this long to get this one. My first one was terrible. This allows me to see my baby fully and be able to monitor her without it sliding all over the place and having to readjust it a million times. Would HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: nvhome

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of mind
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I can see my baby in his rear facing car seat easily in my rear view mirror. Gives me a lot of confidence that he is doing well. I like how big it is. So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Reader4Life

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this product-I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. It’s larger than I expected. The image is clear. I love being able to check in on my little one as I’m driving and know he is safe and admire his cuteness. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: H. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Best mirror ever bought. It adjusts perfectly to any angle. Love it so much we’re going to purchase more for our other vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Mock

customer_reviews.title: Big.  Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews and saw posted pictures of this product with broken pieces. I was skeptical, but thought the price was right. It’s bigger than I expected, but not disappointed. It does the job it’s meant to do. Works great. No worries about it breaking. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: barudin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Functional Well
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to install and doesn't stay in place well. If bumped at all it moves a significant amount. Our carseat has brushed it a couple of times and they left significant scuffs. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: The mirror is nice and large but the issue I’m having is the tightening and loosing to get it to fit correctly. It’s got the part where seems like just impossible to loosen or tighten them. I got so frustrated I almost just bought new one like my daughers.
customer_reviews.author: littledff

customer_reviews.title: Great size!
customer_reviews.text: Really like that this mirror size. I got this to use when I have my grandson in the car, I did not like not being able to see him while I was sitting in front. This is a very sturdy mirror and attacks nicely to the middle headrest (which is smaller than outer ones). I like that you can adjust it also without having to unstrap it and re-secure it. Like I said earlier the size is wonderful also. Glad I made the purchase, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: debbie jo

customer_reviews.title: So so mirror
customer_reviews.text: The mirror is ok if you have superhuman vision. It goes onto the headrest in the back seat easily which is nice. And I can see the baby sort of, but he looks so small and very hard for me to make out any details. I've stopped trying to use it bec I'm squinting so much that I might crash the car.
customer_reviews.author: TishTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice wide mirror that allows you a good, non-distorted view of your child. I've owned two other mirrors and this one was the best of all of them. Other mirrors are either really small, hard to adjust, or so curved the reflection is really distorted. Not the case with this mirror. I'd highly recommend it. I loved it so much I went out and got one for my husband to replace his current backseat mirror and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Beenut20

customer_reviews.title: Nice mirror
customer_reviews.text: Good buy description should of stated it has straps and buckles made for seats that have open gaps not headrests and seat that are one piece
customer_reviews.author: Mallori Briscoe

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Great product for us anxious mothers. I love that I can see what my son is doing. I have used this in 2 different vehicles and while it is a little annoying to get set up once its up you don't need to mess with it again.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It was a little hard to put on and get situated but after that, it's perfect! My baby really enjoys being able to see my husband and I and it eases my worry now that I can see her.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Big mirror which is helpful but made of cheaper plastic do not very high quality. Also don’t love the way it connects to the seat head rest, would have preferred Velcro or something. Works but could be better
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Got this mirror to use for my infant in my Gmc Acadia. It's very simple to install, the straps are adjustable for different sized headrests and the mirror is mounted on a firm plate but adjusts in 4 directions. Unlike other baby mirrors this one is well made and not blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Christina A.
